We undertook an intensive survey of the published literature to compile values for 11 traits that capture the sensitivity of each species to climate change. As described below, sensitivity was based on: narrow thermal tolerance
3, 81 ; geographically localised or restricted to a single climatic zone
15 ; specialised habitat
10, 15 or dietary requirements
3 , slow reproductive rate
40 ; temperature-dependent sex determination or small clutches
13 ; low rate of offspring survival; and long generation length
7 or life span
40 . Although some of these traits are correlated (e.g., generation length and life span), we included them in the analysis because these traits often interact to determine a species sensitivity to climate change. Unless otherwise stated, values for the above traits were obtained from Chapple
82 and Greer
